allModels.name: order_identifier
allModels.description: Represents alternate identifiers that can be used to lookup an order. Common use cases are to support attaching a primary identifier (e.g. a nice order number) post order submission or attaching IDs that are used by the warehouse to ship the orders.

fields.name: primary
fields.description: An order can optionally have a single additional primary identifier. Common pattern here is using a random UUID in checkout sessions, then later assigning a human readable order number.

deprecation.description: This field was renamed to 'identifier'

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order number for which you are assigning this identifier

deprecation.description: This field is deprecated. Please use the 'identifier' field

fields.name: primary
fields.description: If you set this to true, creates the order identifier and marks it as primary. If there already exists a prior primary identifier, that identifier will be updated to no longer by the primary

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order number for which you are assigning this identifier

fields.name: primary
fields.description: If you set this to true, creates the order identifier and marks it as primary. If there already exists a prior primary identifier, that identifier will be updated to no longer by the primary

allModels.name: order_number_generator_hexadecimal
allModels.description: Hexadecimal generator generates a random string, starting with a letter, of a given length

allModels.name: order_number_generator_prefix_suffix
allModels.description: Generator with an optional prefix, followed by an integer and an optional suffix

fields.name: fixed_length
fields.description: Optionally force a fixed length with padding. For example, an order number of F1234 with fixed length '6' and padding '0' would become 'F01234'

allModels.name: order_number_generator_uuid
allModels.description: Generates an order number based on a UUID (no dashes or other formatting). This is the default for Flow orders (with order number prefixed by ord-)

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: Optional prefix to prepend to the UUID

allModels.name: order_payment
allModels.description: An Order Payment represents an individual payment applied to an order. The type of the payment can be used to further lookup transaction level detail

fields.name: reference
fields.description: The reference identifier for the details behind this order payment. For example, if this payment was a card payment, the reference will be the unique authorization key.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Human understandable description of this payment method

fields.name: address
fields.description: Billing address associated with this payment

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Integration-specific attributes of this payment.

allModels.name: order_price_detail
allModels.description: Represents a top-level order price detail, e.g. 'Subtotal' or 'VAT'.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key indicating what this price detail represents.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO-4217 3 character currency code in which the amount is calculated.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total cost of the price detail in the currency of the experience in which the order is placed.

fields.name: label
fields.description: The formatted label for this price detail that should be displayed to the user.

fields.name: base
fields.description: The amount of this price detail in the base currency of the organization.

fields.name: components
fields.description: Contains the components of this price detail that are used to calculate the total.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The display name for this order price detail.

fields.name: rate
fields.description: Optional rate for this order price detail if the key relates to a VAT or Duty.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO-4217 3 character currency code in which the amount is calculated.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total cost of the price detail component in the currency of the experience in which the order is placed.

fields.name: base
fields.description: The amount of this price detail component in the base currency of the organization.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The display name for this order price detail component.

fields.name: min
fields.description: Minimum amount to be eligible for the trigger

allModels.name: order_put_form
allModels.description: The order put form is used to upsert an order, providing the details on pricing and delivery options for destination and items/quantities specified.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer who actually is making the purchase. We recommend providing as much information as you have, notably email address which can be used to increase acceptance rates if Flow is processing payment for this order. If you can also provide your customer number - we can link multiple orders for each customer in the Flow console.

fields.name: delivered_duty
fields.description: Options returned will only use tiers with the matching delivered duty. This would also affect whether duties are included in the total or not. If not specified, defaults based on the experience default setting.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: Selected list of delivery options for this quote. The original order will contain one or more deliveries. Each delivery will contain one or more shipping options (e.g. standard or express). We need to know which shipping options the user selected in order to provide accurate, local shipping pricing. You should only specify if you are explicitly changing the delivery options

fields.name: discount
fields.description: An optional discount to apply to the entire order

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

fields.name: authorization_keys
fields.description: Sets the authorization keys to associate with this order. Each authorization, if valid, will then be added to the order.payments field.

allModels.name: original_prices
allModels.description: Model representing original and max values and currencies.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A collection of active tags for this payment such as whether it is denied for an organization or to be displayed at checkout.

fields.name: payment_method
fields.description: The payment method associated with this rule.

fields.name: display_position
fields.description: The order in which payment methods will be displayed. Lower numbers will have priority.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Contains content necessary to render the given payment method, such as instructions that explain how to pay.

fields.name: issuers
fields.description: Certain payment methods, such as iDEAL, require the customer to select an issuing bank before they are redirected to submit payment details. If any issuers are present in this field, the customer must select one which will then be included in the call to get the redirect URL.

fields.name: programs
fields.description: A list of available installment plans, if any, that can optionally be applied to this payment method

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key identifying the value of this content.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this content.

fields.name: editable
fields.description: Indicates whether the pricing display settings may be edited.

fields.name: default_tax_display
fields.description: Default tax display setting.

fields.name: default_duty_display
fields.description: Default duty display setting.

fields.name: min
fields.description: Minimum amount to be eligible for the trigger

fields.name: remaining
fields.description: Remaining value necessary to apply the trigger

fields.name: min
fields.description: Minimum amount to be eligible for the trigger

fields.name: applied
fields.description: List of promotions that have been applied to this order. For example, free shipping promotion is applied to the shipping price.

fields.name: available
fields.description: List of available promotions that are applicable for this order. If a promotion is here, the promo is not yet applied to the order, but the order can become eligible for it given some criteria.

fields.name: local
fields.description: The actual limit in the local currency of the order

fields.name: original
fields.description: The actual limit in the original currency in which the rule was defined. For example, Canada may restrict exports over CA$2000 - this value would be set to 2000

fields.name: label

fields.name: intent
fields.description: Optionally specify the meaning of this attribute to ensure accurate processing, such as marking a price that should be localized. Note that specifying an intent may restrict what data types are legal -- for example, a price must also be of type decimal.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Optionally tag attributes with their data type so they are properly validated. If omitted, we will default to string

fields.name: email
fields.description: If known, the user's primary email address. While in most common cases, we expect users to have email addresses, there are edge cases where it is useful to allow a user to NOT have an email address. For example, users interacting solely from mobile devices, guest user accounts, initial onboarding where email is not known, etc. We think by starting off with an optional primary email address we can support these use cases with very little implementation cost.

fields.description: Contains the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: The total amount of VAT applied. VAT is applied to the item price and optionally to the duty/shipping prices based on the destination country.

fields.name: duty
fields.description: The total amount of DUTY applied. Duty is applied to the item price and optionally to the shipping prices based on the destination country, and also will take into account de minimis (thus amount may be zero if de minimis applies).

fields.name: rounding
fields.description: The amount required to meet the rounding requirements from the experience's settings. For example, if an item price is 121.50, and the rounding setting is up to the nearest '1.00', rounding would return .50 here.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The rounded price of the item as seen by customers in price detail pages, which takes into account VAT and duty pricing settings of the experience.

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total price of the item as seen by customers at checkout, which includes the base price, discount, margins, VAT, duty, and rounding.

fields.name: adjustment
fields.description: The total amount the total price was altered due to sales margins. A negative value indicates a discount.

fields.name: contracted_rate

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The value of the currency conversion rate that includes an organization-specific margin if applicable.

fields.name: pricing
fields.description: Contains pricing settings for VAT, duty, and rounding.

fields.name: base_price
fields.description: The base price of the product.

fields.name: discount
fields.description: The discount to apply to the base price of the product in the same currency as the base product.

fields.name: fixed_margin
fields.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

fields.name: percent_margin
fields.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

fields.name: insurance
fields.description: The insurance information associated with the product.

fields.name: freight
fields.description: The freight information associated with the product.

fields.name: duty
fields.description: The duty rate applicable to the product. A value of 15 indicates a duty rate of 15%.

fields.name: tax
fields.description: The tax rate applicable to the product. A value of 17 indicates a tax rate of 17%.

fields.name: percent_sales_margin
fields.description: A percent sales margin to apply after the other margins, duties, taxes and margins. A value of 17 indicates an increase of 17%. A value of 5.5 indicates a discount of 5.5%

allModels.name: card
allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. This value should be kept secure in your system's as payment authorizations are created against this token.

fields.name: iin
fields.description: The issuer identification number (IIN) (formerly known as the Bank Identification Number) which are the leading digits of the card number.

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: Added in october 2018

fields.name: last4
fields.description: Cleartext last 4 numbers of the card

fields.name: name
fields.description: Cardholder name

fields.name: address
fields.description: Cardholder billing address

The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: challenge_cipher
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. fields.description: Determines whether or not you want to create a permanent, tokenized card or a one time use token. By default, authenticated API requests create permanent tokens. Unauthenticated requests will create one-time tokens - and you will get an error if you try to create a permanent token via an unauthorized request.

allModels.name: refund_form
allModels.description: Refund actually transfers funds. You can refund as many times as you'd like up until the total amount of captured funds has been refunded. Note when creating a refund you can specify either an order authorization id, a capture id, or an order number (or all of them as long as they match).

fields.name: authorization_id
fields.description: The Id of the authorization against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will look at all captures for this authorization, selecting 1 or more captures against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: capture_id
fields.description: The Id of the capture against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will only consider this capture.

fields.name: order_number
fields.description: The order number if specified during authorization. If specified, we will lookup all authorizations made against this order number, and then selecting 1 or more authorizations against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Your unique identifier for this transaction, which if provided is used to implement idempotency. If not provided, we will assign.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to refund, in the currency of the associated capture. Defaults to the value of the capture minus any prior refunds.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217-3 code for the currency. Required if amount is specified. Case insensitive. Note you will get an error if the currency does not match the related authorization's currency. See https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: rma_key
fields.description: The RMA key, if available. If specified, this will update the RMA status as refunded.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a refund object

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217-3 code for the currency. Case insensitive. See https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: captured
fields.description: The total amount of funds captured for this order. If there were multiple captures, this number will include the sum of the amounts captured.

fields.name: refunded
fields.description: The total amount of refunds issued for this order. If there were multiple refunds, this number will include the sum of the amounts refunded.

fields.name: amounts
fields.description: Suggested amounts to refund based on the most common use cases

allModels.name: refund_order_summary_amounts
allModels.description: Detailed examples of amount to refund following common e-commerce use cases.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The total amount of funds available to refund (sum of all captures minus all prior refunds).

fields.name: balance_excluding_shipping
fields.description: The balance minus shipping costs. If there was either no shipping cost or the remaining balance is less than the shipping cost, this field will not be provided.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: The total amount of shipping on the order, if there was a shipping fee. We highlight this value separately to simplify use cases where a full refund minus shipping is used.

values.description: Provides status check of Flow variant metafields sync to Shopify

values.name: none
values.description: In no scenario should a customer pay tax within the Flow system.

values.name: all
values.description: In all scenarios a customer should pay tax within the Flow system.

values.name: invalid_order_number
values.description: Indicates the specified order does not exist

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_description
values.description: Indicates that the description is invalid (must be non-empty)

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Indicates that a credit payment with the specified key already exists

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization key does not exist

values.name: invalid_authorization_amount
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization amount does not match the first installment in the plan

values.name: invalid_installment_plan
values.description: Indicates the specified installment plan does not exist

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language
values.description: Indicates that the specified language code is not valid

values.name: item_out_of_stock
values.description: Indicates that one or more ordered items is marked as out-of-stock or otherwise cannot be reserved. We will list the specific out-of-stock items in the numbers field

values.name: gift_card_not_accepted
values.description: Indicates a failure to charge a gift card. Error message will indicate when retries are possible.

values.name: total_changed
values.description: Indicates that the order total has changed, likely due to pricebook update or rate change. This is not an error but the consumer should be shown the new price before continuing checkout.

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

allEnums.name: order_payment_type
allEnums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: adjustment

values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis

values.name: subtotal_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to duty owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

allEnums.name: authorization_decline_code
allEnums.description: Contains details related to the reason for which an authorization was declined.

values.name: store_card
values.description: If set, and the authorization is created using a one time nonce, we automatically tokenize and store the card. In these cases you will want to store the new card token in the authorization response (card object)

allEnums.name: authorization_option
allEnums.description: Specifies optional behaviors that can be applied during an authorization

values.name: redirect
values.description: Indicates that the user should be redirected to the provided URL.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that more time is needed before the authorization result is known. In the case of 3D Secure, this means the authorization status should be polled until it is no longer pending.

allEnums.name: authorization_result_action_type
allEnums.description: Specifies an action necessary to continue processing the authorization, such as redirecting to a payment issuer to complete user verification.

values.name: pending
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'pending'. For example, online payment methods like AliPay or PayPal will have a status of 'pending' until the user completes the payment. Pending authorizations expire if the user does not complete the payment in a timely fashion.

values.name: expired
values.description: Authorization has expired.

values.name: authorized
values.description: Authorization was successful

values.name: review
values.description: If an immediate response is not available, the state will be 'review' - this usually indicates fraud review requires additional time / verification (or a potential network issue with the issuing bank)

values.name: declined
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been declined by the issuing bank. See the authorization decline code for more details as to the reason for decline.

values.name: reversed
values.description: Indicates the authorization has been fully reversed. You can fully reverse an authorization up until the moment you capture funds; once you have captured funds you must create refunds.

values.name: match
values.description: Full match

values.name: partial
values.description: Partial match; see details in 'avs' model to understand which components matched

values.name: unsupported
values.description: Issuer does not support address verification

values.name: no_match
values.description: Address does not match expected card values

values.name: expired
values.description: Payment authorization has expired

values.name: insufficient_funds
values.description: The amount to capture exceeded the amount authorized and not yet captured

values.name: unknown
values.description: Failed due to another reason (details not known)

allModels.name: attribute
allModels.description: An attribute can be configured to be used in different ways throughout Flow. A common example is to identify a meaningful attribute (e.g. brand) that can then be displayed throughout the Flow console.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier for the attribute.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key of the attribute that identifies it within a map of attributes.

fields.name: options
fields.description: Defines special rules for handling this attribute.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label used for display purposes.

fields.name: intent
fields.description: Optionally specify the meaning of this attribute to ensure accurate processing, such as marking a price that should be localized. Note that specifying an intent may restrict what data types are legal -- for example, a price must also be of type decimal.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Optionally tag attributes with their data type so they are properly validated. If omitted, we will default to string

fields.name: key

fields.name: margins
fields.description: Contains the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: The total amount of VAT applied. VAT is applied to the item price and optionally to the duty/shipping prices based on the destination country.

fields.name: duty
fields.description: The total amount of DUTY applied. Duty is applied to the item price and optionally to the shipping prices based on the destination country, and also will take into account de minimis (thus amount may be zero if de minimis applies).

fields.name: rounding
fields.description: The amount required to meet the rounding requirements from the experience's settings. For example, if an item price is 121.50, and the rounding setting is up to the nearest '1.00', rounding would return .50 here.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The rounded price of the item as seen by customers in price detail pages, which takes into account VAT and duty pricing settings of the experience.

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total price of the item as seen by customers at checkout, which includes the base price, discount, margins, VAT, duty, and rounding.

fields.name: adjustment
fields.description: The total amount the total price was altered due to sales margins. A negative value indicates a discount.

fields.name: contracted_rate
fields.description: The value of the contracted currency conversion rate between Flow and an organization.

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The value of the currency conversion rate that includes an organization-specific margin if applicable.

fields.name: pricing
fields.description: Contains pricing settings for VAT, duty, and rounding.

fields.name: base_price
fields.description: The base price of the product.

fields.name: discount
fields.description: The discount to apply to the base price of the product in the same currency as the base product.

fields.name: fixed_margin
fields.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

fields.name: percent_margin
fields.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

fields.name: insurance
fields.description: The insurance information associated with the product.

fields.name: freight
fields.description: The freight information associated with the product.

fields.name: duty
fields.description: The duty rate applicable to the product. A value of 15 indicates a duty rate of 15%.

fields.name: tax
fields.description: The tax rate applicable to the product. A value of 17 indicates a tax rate of 17%.

fields.name: percent_sales_margin
fields.description: A percent sales margin to apply after the other margins, duties, taxes and margins. A value of 17 indicates an increase of 17%. A value of 5.5 indicates a discount of 5.5%

allModels.name: pricing
allModels.description: Pricing determines how the item price is calculated when items are requests via the experience.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: Determines how VAT is treated within this experience - whether it is included in the item price, displayed as a stand alone line item, or ignored - and only used in checkout (see the orders resource)

fields.name: duty
fields.description: Determines how Duty is treated within this experience - whether it is included in the item price, displayed as a stand alone line item, or ignored - and only used in checkout (see the orders resource)

fields.name: rounding
fields.description: If specified, we will round prices in this experience

allModels.name: tax
allModels.description: Represents a simple model of taxes that apply to a given item / destination.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the taxes being applied

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The combined tax rate. A value of 17 indicates a tax rate of 17%

fields.name: components
fields.description: The components to which tax is applied.

fields.name: deminimis
fields.description: Describes the tax de minimis if there is one for this destination

allModels.name: generic_error
allModels.description: An error of some type has occurred. The most common error will be validation on input. See messages for details.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Generic errors will always have a code set to 'generic_error'

allUnions.name: expandable_subcatalog
allUnions.description: A subcatalog can be represented with just it's ID, or the entire model

allUnions.name: localized_price
allUnions.description: The localized prices for an item are returned as a list - the key of each element is defined here

allUnions.name: flow_role
allUnions.description: All roles available to attach to a user.

allUnions.name: deminimis
allUnions.description: De Minimis describes the country specific rules for exactly how tax and duties are calculated, as well as any exemptions that apply. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_minimis for more information.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: If the duty de minimis value has not been met, an adjustment may be made to offset any previously calculated duty.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: If the VAT de minimis value has not been met, an adjustment may be made to offset any previously calculated VAT.

allEnums.name: adjustment_reason_key
allEnums.description: The key of each possible adjustment is defined here.

values.name: brand

values.name: color
values.description: The color of the item

values.name: countries_of_origin
values.description: A space separated list of the countries of origin for this item

values.name: product_id
values.description: An identifier used to group items that are variations of the same product, such as different sizes or colors of the same shirt

values.name: fulfillment_method
values.description: Identifies whether the item is a physical or digital good

values.name: hazardous
values.description: Identifies whether this item may contain hazardous materials

values.name: price
values.description: A price for the item in the organization's base currency (will be localized based on each Experience's pricing policy)

values.name: size
values.description: A size label of the item

values.name: sku
values.description: An SKU for the item

values.name: taxability
values.description: Identifies whether taxes are applicable to an item

values.name: consumer_url
values.description: A URL of the product detail page of the item

values.name: gtin
values.description: The Global Trade Item Number of this item.

values.name: mpn
values.description: The Manufacturer Part Number of this item.

values.name: excluded_regions
values.description: A space separated list of the regions (as defined in https://api.flow.io/reference/regions) where the item must be excluded.

allEnums.name: attribute_intent
allEnums.description: Used to tag attributes as having a specific meaning that can affect processing. For example, if you have an attribute called "brandname", and assign it the "brand" intent, the value of the "brandname" attribute will be used where a brand name is needed. Note that an intent can be assigned to any amount of attributes of an item.

values.name: fulfillment_method
values.description: Indicates how an item will be shipped or fulfilled.  Acceptable values are defined by the 'fulfillment_method_value' enum.

allEnums.name: fulfillment_method_type
allEnums.description: Used to indicate an item's fulfillment method type.

values.name: digital
values.description: Indicates item will be fulfilled digitally and no shipment is required (e.g. Gift Card).

values.name: physical
values.description: Indicates item will be shipped in a physical package.

allEnums.name: fulfillment_method_value
allEnums.description: Used to indicate an item's fulfillment method values.

values.name: thumbnail
values.description: Thumbnail images identify the image to use when displaying products in the Flow Console.

values.name: checkout
values.description: Checkout images identify the item image to use when displaying the item in the context of a consumer checkout (e.g. cart, checkout page).

values.name: exclusion
values.description: Exclude items satisfied by the associated query

values.name: inclusion
values.description: Include items satisfied by the associated query

allEnums.name: query_type
allEnums.description: Type to indicate whether query is an inclusion or exclusion

values.name: excluded
values.description: The user has chosen to exclude the item from the associated subcatalog.

values.name: included
values.description: The item is included in the associated subcatalog.

values.name: restricted
values.description: Item is not allowed to be sold in the market associated with the given subcatalog.

allEnums.name: subcatalog_item_status
allEnums.description: Status indicating availability of a subcatalog item in an experience.

values.name: tax_rule
values.description: Rule indicating how taxes should be applied.  Acceptable values are defined by the 'taxability_value' enum.

values.name: exempt
values.description: An item with this value is exempt from being taxed.

allEnums.name: taxability_value
allEnums.description: Used to indicate an item's taxability.

values.name: queue
values.description: Queue item update for approval.

values.name: anonymous
values.description: No authentication necessary.

values.name: session
values.description: A browser has been assigned an identifier by flow to track their use of our service for an organization.

values.name: token
values.description: A token. Tokens carry the same permissions as the user who originally created them.

values.name: partner_token
values.description: A partner token. Partner Tokens can only access anonymous endpoints and the endpoints of the partner api.

values.name: user
values.description: A user logs into Flow.

allEnums.name: authentication_technique
allEnums.description: Various techniques a client request will use to authenticate with Flow.

values.name: consumer_data_viewer
values.description: Can view consumer's private data

values.name: membership_manager
values.description: Can invite new users to the org.

allEnums.name: flow_addon_role
allEnums.description: Default addon roles supported by Flow. These roles don't provide enough access to be useful on their own but convey additional responsibility to user roles.

values.name: view_consumer_data
values.description: Allows user to view consumers' personal data.

allEnums.name: flow_behavior
allEnums.description: Behaviors represent cross-cutting concerns that may be assigned via roles and may apply to many API endpoints.

values.name: organization_admin
values.description: Can fully administrate a merchant organization.

values.name: organization_merchant
values.description: Can access merchant functions such as analytics, billing, experiences.

values.name: organization_operations
values.description: Can access customer service functions and retreive relevant data.

values.name: organization_fulfillment
values.description: Can access fulfillment functions and retreive relevant data.

values.name: organization_marketing
values.description: Can access marketing functions and retreive relevant data.

values.name: organization_finance
values.description: Can access billing and reconcilliation functions and retreive relevant data.

values.name: flow_operations
values.description: Can access Flow internal functions.

allEnums.name: flow_user_role
allEnums.description: Default user roles supported by Flow

allEnums.name: permitted_http_method
allEnums.description: List of HTTP methods for which user permissions may be applied (OPTION for example is always permitted where CORS is enabled).

values.name: flow
values.description: Represents a Flow rate type (which excludes currency margins)

values.name: organization
values.description: Represents an organization rate type (which includes currency margins)

allEnums.name: rate_type
allEnums.description: Indicates the type of the rate

values.name: boolean
values.description: Boolean true/false data type

values.name: decimal
values.description: Decimal datatype without size or precision restrictions. Commonly used for currency values.

values.name: string
values.description: Unvalidated string of characters.

allEnums.name: attribute_data_type
allEnums.description: Used to tag attributes with a data type so they are properly validated.

values.name: weekdays
values.description: Mon - Fri

values.name: everyday
values.description: 7 days per week

values.name: strip_trailing_zeros
values.description: If a price ends in '.00' or ',00', we remove the cents and just display the price as a whole number. e.g. 'A$100.00' becomes 'A$100'

allEnums.name: currency_label_formatter
allEnums.description: A currency label formatter accepts a price label and updates it according to a set of rules.

values.name: narrow
values.description: The narrow format refers to the Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) 'narrow' symbols (e.g. '$' for CAD and AUD)

values.name: primary
values.description: The primary format refers to the Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) 'primary' symbols (e.g. 'CA$' for CAD and 'A$' for AUD)

allEnums.name: currency_symbol_format
allEnums.description: The currency symbol format controls which set of currency symbols we use when displaying currencies

values.name: paid
values.description: Delivered Duty Paid (DDP). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incoterms for more information

values.name: unpaid
values.description: Delivered Duty Unpaid (DDU). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incoterms for more information

values.name: sandbox
values.description: In sandbox, no external services (e.g. orders, payments, logistics) will generate real transactions

values.name: production
values.description: In production, all external services are live and will generate real transactions

allEnums.name: included_levy_key
allEnums.description: The key of each possible localized price note is defined here.

values.name: EXW

values.name: FCA

values.name: CIP
values.description: Carriage and Insurance Paid to (named place of destination)

values.name: DAT
values.description: Delivered At Terminal (named terminal at port or place of destination)

values.name: DAP
values.description: Delivered At Place (named place of destination)

values.name: DDP
values.description: Delivered Duty Paid (named place of destination)

values.name: FAS

values.name: FOB
values.description: Free on Board (named port of shipment)

values.name: CFR
values.description: Cost and Freight (named port of destination)

values.name: CIF
values.description: Cost, Insurance & Freight (named port of destination)

values.name: DAF

values.name: DES

values.name: DEQ

values.name: DDU

allEnums.name: incoterm
allEnums.description: International Commercial Terms are a series of pre-defined commercial terms published by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) relating to international commercial law.

values.name: fixed
values.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

values.name: percent
values.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

allEnums.name: margin_type
allEnums.description: Either a fixed or percent adjustment applied to some amount.

allEnums.name: merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

allEnums.name: order_merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

allEnums.name: role
allEnums.description: A user's role within an organization

values.name: up
values.description: Round up to the specified rounding.value

values.name: down
values.description: Round down to the specified rounding.value

values.name: nearest
values.description: Round to the nearest specified rounding.value. If equidistant, will round up.

allEnums.name: rounding_method
allEnums.description: Direction to round localized price

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.name: rounding_type
allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

values.name: millimeter
values.description: Equivalent to MILLI(METRE).

values.name: centimeter
values.description: Equivalent to CENTI(METRE).

values.name: inch
values.description: A unit of length equal to 0.0254 m (standard name in).

values.name: foot
values.description: A unit of length equal to 0.3048 m (standard name ft).

values.name: cubic_inch
values.description: A unit of volume equal to one cubic inch (in³).

values.name: cubic_meter
values.description: The metric unit for volume quantities (m³).

values.name: gram
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 1 / 1000 kilogram (standard name g).

values.name: kilogram
values.description: The base unit for mass quantities (kg).

values.name: meter
values.description: The base unit for length quantities (m).

values.name: ounce
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 1 / 16 POUND (standard name oz).

values.name: pound
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 453.59237 grams (avoirdupois pound, standard name lb).

allEnums.name: unit_of_measurement
allEnums.description: Defines the units of measurement that we support. As units are added, we conform with the standard units provided by jscience as part of JSR 363 - see http://jscience.org/api/javax/measure/unit/SI.html and http://jscience.org/api/javax/measure/unit/NonSI.html

allEnums.name: unit_of_time
allEnums.description: Defines the units of time that we support

values.name: pending
values.description: Represents a new user account that is pending approval

values.name: active
values.description: Represents an active user account - can authenticate with this account

values.name: inactive
values.description: Represents an inactive user account - can no longer authenticate with this account

allEnums.name: user_status
allEnums.description: The status of the user account. Valid transitions are from pending -> active, active -> inactive, inactive -> active

values.name: Hazardous Material
values.description: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ORM-D

values.name: goods
values.description: The value of goods

values.name: vat
values.description: Value-Added Tax

values.name: base_price
values.description: The base price of the item.

values.name: discount
values.description: A discount applied to the base price of the item.

values.name: currency_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price due to FX markup, as configured in the organization's currency settings.

values.name: percent_item_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price from a percent item margin. Negative amounts represent discounts.

values.name: fixed_item_margin
values.description: The amount added to the post-discount item price from a fixed item margin. Negative amounts represent discounts.

values.name: duties_item_price
values.description: The duty owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: duties_added_margin
values.description: The duty owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: duties_rounding
values.description: The duty owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: duties_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment made if the item does not meet the duty de minimis rule.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: vat_added_margin
values.description: The VAT owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: vat_rounding
values.description: The VAT owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: vat_duties_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on the post-discount base item price.

values.name: vat_duties_added_margin
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on the sum of the currency margin, percent item margin, and fixed item margin.

values.name: vat_duties_rounding
values.description: The VAT owed on the duty owed on any rounding applied to the total item price.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment made if the item does not meet the VAT de minimis rule.

values.name: item_price_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to the item price as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: margins_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to the item margins as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: rounding_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to rounding as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: vat_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to VAT owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: vat_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to VAT on duties (e.g. VAT on duties on item price) owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: An adjustment made to duty owed as a result of a percent sales margin.

values.name: item_price
values.description: The details of the item price.

values.name: margins
values.description: The details of any margins added to the item price.

values.name: vat
values.description: The details of any VAT owed on the item.

values.name: duty
values.description: The details of any duties owed on the item.

values.name: rounding
values.description: The details of any rounding added to the item.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: The details of any price adjustments due to sales margins. A negative value indicates a discount.

values.name: generic_error
values.description: Generic errors are the default type. The accompanying message will provide details on the failure.

values.name: client_error
values.description: A client error has occurred. This represents a misconfiguration of the client

values.name: server_error
values.description: A server error has occurred. The Flow tech team is automatically notified of all server errors

allModels.name: order
allModels.description: An order represents all of the information about a particular set of line items, including pricing, currency rates, delivery options, etc. All information in an order is guaranteed by Flow - if an order is submitted before its expiration. The intended use case is to create an order as a consumer enters checkout, then to submit that order as part of the user submitting their order. Note that Flow will automatically mark an order submitted if we see payment authorization(s) covering the full balance of an order.

fields.name: merchant_of_record
fields.description: Once an order is fully paid, we record who the merchant of record for this order is.

fields.name: experience
fields.description: Contains information on the experience on which this order was submitted.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The customer who is actually making the purchase

fields.name: delivered_duty
fields.description: Options returned will only use tiers with the matching delivered duty. This would also affect whether duties are included in the total or not. If not specified, defaults based on the experience default setting.

fields.name: expires_at
fields.description: The date and time on which this order will expire unless submitted. Used only when the order status is 'open'. New orders will expire 1 hour after creation.

fields.name: selections
fields.description: The currently selected delivery option ids. These IDs represent the shipping tiers that the customer has chosen (e.g. standard or express) for each delivery. The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the charge in a structured format.

fields.name: submitted_at
fields.description: The timestamp on which the order is submitted. Once submitted, production orders can no longer be deleted as they represent transactions in the real world

fields.name: lines

fields.name: identifiers
fields.description: Other identifiers which are used to identify this order, if available.

fields.name: promotions
fields.description: The current available and applied promotions for this order

fields.name: payments
fields.description: Represents the list of payments on an order. Each payment will be typed - supporting options like a $25 account credit applied to an order plus a balance paid by a card, paypal, cash on delivery, etc. The list of payments here is summary information only for display back to the user; each individual payment will have varying levels of detail based on the actual type of the payment

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The remaining balance on this order. Will be marked required in a future version of the Flow API

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Represents a summary of the rules related to this order.

fields.name: tax_registration

fields.description: The ISO 3166-3 country code. Case insensitive. See https://api.flow.io/reference/countries

The shipping price is then based on these selections (and included in the prices array). You can update an order before it has been submitted to change the delivery options, getting back accurate pricing for the order.

allModels.name: card
allModels.description: Card represents the metadata about a secure, tokenized card. The card 'token' is a unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. The card token itself will either be a permanent card token (denoted by a prefix of F96) or a one time nonce (denoted by a prefix of F17). Nonces represent cards that were encrypted from public channels (like the user's browser via JavaScript) and can be used once only. If you have a nonce you can exchange it for a permanent card token via the operation POST /:organization/cards/nonces

fields.name: token
fields.description: Unique, cryptographically secure token by which this card can be identified in the future. This value should be kept secure in your system's as payment authorizations are created against this token.

fields.name: iin
fields.description: The issuer identification number (IIN) (formerly known as the Bank Identification Number) which are the leading digits of the card number.

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: Added in october 2018

fields.name: last4
fields.description: Cleartext last 4 numbers of the card

fields.name: name
fields.description: Cardholder name

fields.name: address
fields.description: Cardholder billing address

fields.name: expiration_month
fields.description: The month of expiration expressed as a number. 1 = January, 12 = December

fields.name: challenge_text
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: challenge_cipher
fields.description: When providing a cipher, you can optionally provide a challenge text and challenge cipher that will allow us to verify that client side encryption worked properly, returning better error messages in some cases. The Flow JavaScript API uses the challenge to verify that the asymmetric encryption is working properly in the client.

fields.name: token_type
fields.description: Determines whether or not you want to create a permanent, tokenized card or a one time use token. By default, authenticated API requests create permanent tokens. Unauthenticated requests will create one-time tokens - and you will get an error if you try to create a permanent token via an unauthorized request.

allModels.name: refund_form
allModels.description: Refund actually transfers funds. You can refund as many times as you'd like up until the total amount of captured funds has been refunded. Note when creating a refund you can specify either an order authorization id, a capture id, or an order number (or all of them as long as they match).

fields.name: authorization_id
fields.description: The Id of the authorization against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will look at all captures for this authorization, selecting 1 or more captures against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: capture_id
fields.description: The Id of the capture against which to issue the refund. If specified, we will only consider this capture.

fields.name: order_number
fields.description: The order number if specified during authorization. If specified, we will lookup all authorizations made against this order number, and then selecting 1 or more authorizations against which to issue the refund of the requested amount.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Your unique identifier for this transaction, which if provided is used to implement idempotency. If not provided, we will assign.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to refund, in the currency of the associated capture. Defaults to the value of the capture minus any prior refunds.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The ISO 4217-3 code for the currency. Required if amount is specified. Case insensitive. Note you will get an error if the currency does not match the related authorization's currency. See https://api.flow.io/reference/currencies

fields.name: rma_key
fields.description: The RMA key, if available. If specified, this will update the RMA status as refunded.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a refund object

fields.name: shipping

values.name: everyday

values.name: strip_trailing_zeros
values.description: If a price ends in '.00' or ',00', we remove the cents and just display the price as a whole number. e.g. 'A$100.00' becomes 'A$100'

values.name: narrow

values.name: primary
values.description: The primary format refers to the Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) 'primary' symbols (e.g. 'CA$' for CAD and 'A$' for AUD)

allEnums.name: currency_symbol_format

values.name: paid

values.name: unpaid
values.description: Delivered Duty Unpaid (DDU). See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Incoterms for more information

values.name: sandbox
values.description: In sandbox, no external services (e.g. orders, payments, logistics) will generate real transactions

values.name: production

allEnums.name: included_levy_key

allEnums.name: incoterm
allEnums.description: International Commercial Terms are a series of pre-defined commercial terms published by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) relating to international commercial law.

values.name: fixed
values.description: A fixed amount to add, e.g 2.5 would add an absolute margin of 2.5 in the base currency of your item.

values.name: percent
values.description: A percent of the base cost to add, e.g. 1.2 would represent a 1.2% increase.

allEnums.name: margin_type
allEnums.description: Either a fixed or percent adjustment applied to some amount.

allEnums.name: merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The merchant of record enum defines who is merchant of record for a particular transaction - either Flow is serving as the merchant of record or the organization is serving as merchant of record.

allEnums.name: order_merchant_of_record
allEnums.description: The order merchant of record defines who is merchant of record for a particular order. The value will be 'mixed' if you support split payments and the merchant of record differed across the individual payment transactions.

allEnums.name: role
allEnums.description: A user's role within an organization

values.name: up
values.description: Round up to the specified rounding.value

values.name: down
values.description: Round down to the specified rounding.value

values.name: nearest
values.description: Round to the nearest specified rounding.value. If equidistant, will round up.

allEnums.name: rounding_method
allEnums.description: Direction to round localized price

values.name: pattern
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount ending with a pattern, e.g. an amount ending in '.99'.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Rounds a value to an amount that is the multiple of a value, e.g. rounding to the nearest 5 would ensure that the resulting number ends in either 0 or 5.

allEnums.name: rounding_type
allEnums.description: Rounding type determines the rule used to enforce rounding. Common rules will ensure that the final price ends w/ a given number (e.g. ends with .95) or is a multiple of some number (multiples of 5 or 10 are common).

values.name: millimeter
values.description: Equivalent to MILLI(METRE).

values.name: centimeter
values.description: Equivalent to CENTI(METRE).

values.name: inch
values.description: A unit of length equal to 0.0254 m (standard name in).

values.name: foot
values.description: A unit of length equal to 0.3048 m (standard name ft).

values.name: cubic_inch
values.description: A unit of volume equal to one cubic inch (in³).

values.name: cubic_meter
values.description: The metric unit for volume quantities (m³).

values.name: gram
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 1 / 1000 kilogram (standard name g).

values.name: kilogram
values.description: The base unit for mass quantities (kg).

values.name: meter
values.description: The base unit for length quantities (m).

values.name: ounce
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 1 / 16 POUND (standard name oz).

values.name: pound
values.description: A unit of mass equal to 453.59237 grams (avoirdupois pound, standard name lb).

allEnums.name: unit_of_measurement
allEnums.description: Defines the units of measurement that we support. As units are added, we conform with the standard units provided by jscience as part of JSR 363 - see http://jscience.org/api/javax/measure/unit/SI.html and http://jscience.org/api/javax/measure/unit/NonSI.html

allEnums.name: unit_of_time
allEnums.description: Defines the units of time that we support

values.name: pending
values.description: Represents a new user account that is pending approval

values.name: active
values.description: Represents an active user account - can authenticate with this account

values.name: inactive
values.description: Represents an inactive user account - can no longer authenticate with this account

allEnums.name: user_status
allEnums.description: The status of the user account. Valid transitions are from pending -> active, active -> inactive, inactive -> active

values.name: Hazardous Material
values.description: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ORM-D

values.name: mixed
values.description: A delivery estimate may be a combination of multiple sources

values.name: available
values.description: Inventory is generally available for purchase

values.name: low
values.description: Inventory is low and may soon become unavailable for purchase. Unless there is a specific use case for low inventory, it can be treated the same as 'available'

values.name: out_of_stock
values.description: There is no inventory available and is not available for purchase. Sample actions that can be taken are hiding the item or marking as `sold out` on the frontend

values.name: oldest
values.description: Use the oldest center by creation date.

values.name: fastest
values.description: Optimize for fastest average time in transit across all tiers from the center on the lane

values.name: lowest_cost
values.description: Optimize for lowest average cost across all tiers from the center on the lane

allEnums.name: lane_strategy
allEnums.description: Strategy to select origin center on a shipping lane with multiple capable shipping origin centers

values.name: items_not_available
values.description: Item numbers are not available in inventory

values.name: direct
values.description: Always generate a label for the chosen delivery option.

values.name: information
values.description: Booking and label generation is not available. Just use Flow to calculate delivery window estimates and shipment prices to display.

values.name: preadvice
values.description: A generic label will be provided by the client organization when available as pre-advice shipment notification to carrier partner.

allEnums.name: shipment_integration_type
allEnums.description: Type of shipping integration for a given shipping tier

values.name: range
values.description: Tightest range

values.name: from
values.description: Lowest minimum of the ranges

values.name: to
values.description: Lowest maximum of the ranges

values.name: organization
values.description: The merchant pays for this surcharge

values.name: customer
values.description: The customer pays for this surcharge

allEnums.name: tier_direction
allEnums.description: Describes fulfillment direction of this logistics tier

values.name: calculated
values.description: Displays the calculated delivery window estimate next to the shipping tier name.

values.name: custom
values.description: Shows a custom label next to the shipping tier name instead of a delivery window estimate.

allEnums.name: tier_estimate_type
allEnums.description: Describes the type of label displayed for shipping tiers.

values.name: fastest
values.description: Optimize for fastest first, then cheapest

values.name: lowest_cost
values.description: Optimize for lowest cost first, then fastest

allEnums.name: tier_strategy
allEnums.description: Strategy to apply when there are multiple rates available for a tier

values.name: zero
values.description: Show the number 0.00 in the label

values.name: free
values.description: Show the word `FREE` in the label

values.name: generic_error
values.description: Generic errors are the default type. The accompanying message will provide details on the failure.

values.name: client_error
values.description: A client error has occurred. This represents a misconfiguration of the client

values.name: server_error
values.description: A server error has occurred. The Flow tech team is automatically notified of all server errors

values.name: invalid_order_number
values.description: Indicates the specified order does not exist

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_description
values.description: Indicates that the description is invalid (must be non-empty)

values.name: duplicate
values.description: Indicates that a credit payment with the specified key already exists

values.name: amount_must_be_positive
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount was <= 0

values.name: amount_exceeds_balance
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the remaining balance on the order

values.name: insufficient_amount
values.description: Indicates the provided credit amount exceeds the maximum amount of applicable credit

values.name: all
values.description: Displays all available options to the customer.

values.name: single
values.description: Displays a single option (either DDU or DDP), while the other can be displayed by changing duties and tax preferences at checkout.

values.name: display
values.description: A displayed payment method will be highlighted during the checkout process for an experience.

values.name: archiving
values.description: Archiving indicates an experience has been archived. We allow some time for sessions to expire before fully marking the experience archived.

values.name: invalid_authorization
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization key does not exist

values.name: invalid_authorization_amount
values.description: Indicates the specified authorization amount does not match the first installment in the plan

values.name: invalid_installment_plan
values.description: Indicates the specified installment plan does not exist

values.name: order_item_not_available
values.description: When creating an order, if a particular item is not available in the country / destination (either because it was restricted or excluded from that country), we return this error code and list the specific item numbers which are not available in the 'numbers' field.

values.name: order_identifier_error
values.description: Indicates that there is no order with the specified number (nor an order for which an order identifier with that number has been created)

values.name: authorization_invalid
values.description: The authorization key specified is invalid - either because it does not exist or is not associated with this order

values.name: domestic_shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country for one of your domicile countries and you have asked Flow not to accept orders for this country.

values.name: shipping_unavailable
values.description: Indicates that an order was created for a country to which you have asked Flow not to ship.

values.name: value_threshold_exceeded
values.description: Indicates the order value exceeds the value threshold for destination and cannot be shipped. When specified, the order will also populate the threshold attribute.

values.name: invalid_currency
values.description: Indicates that the specified currency code is not valid

values.name: invalid_country
values.description: Indicates that the specified country code is not valid

values.name: invalid_region
values.description: Indicates that the specified region code is not valid

values.name: invalid_language
values.description: Indicates that the specified language code is not valid

values.name: item_out_of_stock
values.description: Indicates that one or more ordered items is marked as out-of-stock or otherwise cannot be reserved. We will list the specific out-of-stock items in the numbers field

values.name: gift_card_not_accepted
values.description: Indicates a failure to charge a gift card. Error message will indicate when retries are possible.

values.name: total_changed
values.description: Indicates that the order total has changed, likely due to pricebook update or rate change. This is not an error but the consumer should be shown the new price before continuing checkout.

values.name: card
values.description: Represents a payment in the form of a credit or debit card

values.name: online
values.description: Represents an online payment (e.g. paypal, alipay, etc)

values.name: credit
values.description: A payment in the form of a credit of some type (e.g. a store credit, gift card) applied to an order

values.name: installment_plan
values.description: An installment plan payment represents that the user has elected an installment plan to pay for this order. For the purposes of the order, the balance will reflect fully paid for the total value of the installment plan, even though individual installments may be created in the future.

values.name: cash_on_delivery
values.description: Request to pay the balance with cash on delivery. Offered only when the final mile carriers support cash on delivery.

allEnums.name: order_payment_type
allEnums.description: The order payment type identified the different ways a consumer may have paid for an order. The primary purpose is in displaying summary level payment information to the user; the type can then be used to know how to request additional details for each payment.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: A general purpose adjustment applied to the order.

values.name: vat_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the VAT de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duty_deminimis
values.description: An adjustment based on whether the duty de minimis applies to the order.

values.name: duties_item_price

values.name: duties_freight
values.description: The duty owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.name: duties_insurance
values.description: The duty owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.name: vat_item_price
values.description: The VAT owed on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_freight
values.description: The VAT owed on the freight cost of the order.

values.description: The VAT owed on the insurance cost of the order.

values.description: The VAT owed on the duties on the price of the order's items, including any added margins and rounding.

values.name: vat_duties_freight

values.name: rounding
values.description: The sum of any rounding applied to the order's items.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The insurance cost for the order.

values.name: shipping
values.description: The shipping cost for the order.

values.name: order_discount
values.description: A discount applied to the entire order.

values.name: subtotal_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to item price, margin and rounding made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_vat_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to VAT owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: subtotal_duty_percent_sales_margin
values.description: The sum of adjustments to duty owed made due to percentage sales margins.

values.name: vat_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any VAT subsidized by the organization. For example, if VAT is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific VAT rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: duty_subsidy
values.description: An offset to account for any duty subsidized by the organization. For example, if duty is included in an item price and changes at the order level (due to passing de minimis threshold, or the destination having a more specific duty rate), the difference will be represented here.

values.name: remote_area_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for delivery to a remote area determined by the carrier.

values.name: fuel_surcharge
values.description: Surcharge applied to a shipment for fuel consumption by the carrier.

values.name: adjustment
values.description: The details of any adjustments made to the order.

values.name: subtotal

values.name: vat
values.description: The details of any VAT owed on the order.

values.name: duty

values.name: shipping
values.description: The details of shipping costs for the order.

values.name: insurance
values.description: The details of insurance costs for the order.

values.name: discount
values.description: The details of any discount applied to the order.

values.name: surcharges
values.description: Additional fees and levies applied to the order

values.name: deny

allEnums.name: payment_method_rule_content_key

values.name: automatic
values.description: Automatic indicates the the promotion will be automatically applied to the order

values.name: order_subtotal
values.description: Order subtotal sets a minimum value - orders whose subtotal is greater than the minimum will have the promotion applied. A common use case is to offer free shipping to orders about 150 CAD.

allEnums.name: promotion_trigger_type
allEnums.description: The Promotion Trigger Type defines the conditions we evaluate when deciding if a particular promotion should be applied to an order.

values.name: card
values.description: Represents all form of card payment (e.g. credit, debit, etc.)

values.name: online
values.description: Represents the most common form of alternative payment methods which require some degree of integration online (e.g. a redirect) to complete payment.

values.name: offline

allEnums.name: payment_method_type
allEnums.description: The payment method type defines at a high level different user experiences that are required to accept payment of this type. By enabling a payment method type, you are specifying that you have completed the integration and all payment methods of this type become available for offer to your users.

allEnums.name: attribute_intent

For example, if you have an attribute called "brandname", and assign it the "brand" intent, the value of the "brandname" attribute will be used where a brand name is needed. Note that an intent can be assigned to any amount of attributes of an item.
